item.title: Littering around the local area & on Forburg Road, 13th June
item.description:
The general cleanliness on Forburg Road & surrounding roads are disgusting! The streets are often littered with rubbish that people have just dropped on the pavement, fly tipped or left outside their hones and remains uncollected by the Waste Disposal Team
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed vehicle dangerously obstructing traffic junction, 13th June
item.description:
This car has been blocking the left hand site of the junction from hall place crescent to Bourne road and has been so for almost 8 days. Can this be removed as soon as possible before there is another accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Mead, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Trees need pruning along the road, 13th June
item.description:
The trees along Forburg Road need pruning around the base of the trees. In some parts the pavement is almost inaccessible because the growth around the base and wheelie bins block the pavements. This is a hazard for people in wheelchairs, the elderly etc
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement trip hazards, 13th June
item.description:
Most of Southover has very uneven pavements with large cracks, uneven surfaces and broken pavers. They are trip hazards, looks like it's been caused from years of neglect and heavy machinery

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southover, Sundridge, London

item.title: Missed bin collection and bulky items in street, 13th June
item.description:
Bins bags are collected from this point weekly on Thursday mornings. This was not done again this week as in recent weeks, and there is rubbish blocking the pavement and a bag now in the street. Large bulky waste has also been placed here.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frederick Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing required in area, 13th June
item.description:
There are two schools and a nursery in this area. This road gets very busy especially between school pick up and drop off times. Parents and children have extreme difficulty crossing this road safety and zebra crossing is urgently required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Slade Green Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown tree, 13th June
item.description:
Neighbours tree is in encroaching to my side / dropping branches leafs bug and moving in bad weather. We can not allow my kids in the garden know more due to under line health conditions. My son has just had a major head surgery and if anything hit this we are back to the hospital and branches have fallen . My daughter is allergic to pollen so bad that she needs antihistamines Twice a day every day and tree pollen drops tree sap all over the toys so now she can not go in the garden . My youngest daughter had found a number of bugs see attached photo . I can send in documents off illness of the kids to prove this needs doing as if this hits the boy or daughter had a reaction both need to go to hospital and this is a problem I donâ€™t want Lewisham donâ€™t want . Council bin lorryâ€™s hit this when going around the back to bin collect as this is going in the round . This is a health and safety issue as if this goes over or hits someone Address of the tree is 46 castleton road Resident can not control this and donâ€™t go in there own garden so they donâ€™t care

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castleton Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loud roadworks at 2am, 13th June
item.description:
These roadworks on Walworth Road have been going on all night, they are extremely loud and make it almost impossible to sleep. Regardless of how busy Walworth Road is during the day, there is no way this level of disruption to local residentsâ€™ sleep is a better option than diverting some of the traffic. Please consider working during non-peak daytime hours or even in the early evenings, instead of starting at 10pm and going on through the night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nightly bonfire after 11pm burning waste, 13th June
item.description:
Every night the last 4 weeks, tenants at 143 Rendlesham Road, E5 8PA light a large bonfire in their garden burning building waste after 11pm, burns for hours, creating large amounts of smoke, and sparks flying over their fence. We canâ€™t have windows open.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rendlesham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
